newsitem.title: FRANCE: Third British teenager dies after French bus crash.
newsitem.headline: Third British teenager dies after French bus crash.

text.p: A third British teenager has died overnight from injuries suffered on Monday when a bus carrying children on a school trip in eastern France veered off a road, British and French officials said on Tuesday.
The child, identified by the British Consulate as Keith Ridding, 14, died early on Tuesday in hospital in the Alpine city of Grenoble, the officials said.
His mother was at his side at the time of his death, a British Consulate official said.

The bus had driven off the road on Monday near the town of Moutiers, falling 20 metres (60 feet) into a ravine before eventually coming to rest on its side against a tree. It was carrying 23 passengers from a nearby holiday camp to a rock-climbing site.
The victims were all from the northern British town of Bolton.
Schoolgirl Nicola Moore, 16, died almost immediately after the accident and Robert Boardman,14, died in hospital later.
